title.narrative: Peace and Stabilisation Programme Horn of Africa 2018-2022

description.narrative: Denmark's Peace and Stabilisation Programme for the Horn of Africa 2018-2022 covers Ethiopia, Kenya and Somalia with a special focus on the ongoing conflict in Somalia, recognizing its regional consequences.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

description.narrative: FL §06.32.08.80 Global Framework for Integrated Stabilisation Efforts (development assistance)

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: 1.3 Capacity building and infrastructure development of the Somalia National Police as stipulated in the National Security Policy
The Somali Police Force and the local community are supported with infrastructure renovation, provided with training material and delivery of specific training, and essential equipment is availed.

target.value: 4 out of 6 activities to be implemented: Construction of 2 police stations; 25 Somali Police Officers to be trained in traffic management, regulations and enforcements; 25 Somali Police officers Trained in IED EOD; 50 Somali Police Officers Trained in junior management skills; 50 Somali Senior Police Officers trained in Human Rights aspects; 10 police stations to be equipped with office materials and stationary.

actual.value: 2 two police stations reconstructed, Office equipment provided for police stations (unknown number), traffic management course, IED OED Training for 25 Somali police officers, junior management training for 50 Junior Level Officers, Human Rights course for 50 seinor level commandors

target.value: 4 out of 6 activities to be implemented: 2 police stations to be constructed; 2 Police Stations to be renovated; 10 police stations to be equipped; 25 Somali Police Officers trained on crime scene Investigations; 25 Somali Police Officers trained in Narcotic and Drug investigation; 25 Somali police Officers trained in SGBV and child protection.

3 out of 4 activities to be implemented: 10 police stations to be equipped; Training of 30 senior level Somali Police Officers on leadership and management in Mogadishu; Training of 80 Stationd Commanders (middle level management) on leadership and management; Training of 80 junior level Police Officers on Radio Communication and Signals.

4 out of 6 activities to be implemented: 2 police stations to be constructed; 3 police station to be renovated; 10 police stations to be equipped; 25 Somali Police Officer trained in Criminal Investigative Techniques; 25 Police Officers trained in crime information collection, collation, analysis and dissemination; 50 Somali Police Officers trained in C-IED

actual.value: Ongiong activites from last year: 2 two police stations reconstructed, Office equipment provided for police stations (unknown number), traffic management course, IED OED Training for 25 Somali police officers, junior management training for 50 Junior Level Officers, Human Rights course for 50 seinor level commandors

title.narrative: 1.1 Promotion of reconciliation platforms through workshops, town halls, conferences and community mobilisation and sensitisation

Sensitising youth, women, elders, civil society organisations and the SPF on reconciliation, preventing and countering violent extremism, prevention of recruitment and use of child soldiers in AMISOM areas of operation.

target.value: Community outreach and sensitization workshops targeting 430 people (youth, women, elders, religious leaders, members of the civil society and Police) on issues of de-radicalization and preventing recruitment of child soldiers, political transition, prevention of female genital mutilation; and women rights. Also, including ToTs on the ongoing Constitutional Review Process.

actual.value: Activities in 2019: 1) Awareness raising of women's rights, 2) PCVE enhanced knowledge on radicalisation

target.value: Community outreach and sensitization activities targeting 2555 people (youth, women, elders, religious leaders, members of the civil society and Police) through workshops on issues of Human Rights and prevention of recruitment/use of child soldiers; football tournaments; community consultation meetings; and training of female mediators.

actual.value: Activities in 2020: 1) Awareness raising of women's rights, 2) PCVE enhanced knowledge on radicalisation

target.value: Community outreach and sensitization activities targeting 2595 people (youth, women, elders, religious leaders, members of the civil society and Police) on issues of de-radicalization and preventing recruitment of child soldiers, prevention of female genital mutilation; and women rights; through workshops, football tournaments and community consultation meetings.

Community outreach and sensitisation activities targeting 1388 people (youth, women, elders, religious leaders, members of the civil society) to be sensitised on issues Human Rights, Women's rights, de-radicalisation and child protection, through workshops, football tournaments and community consultation meetings.

title.narrative: AMISOM to contribute to stabilisation and early recovery activities through the provision of some basic services and support the functioning of local administrations as part of efforts to sustain security gains in territories recovered from Al Shabaab.

Sustain territories recovered from Al-Shabaab, through early recovery activities and reconciliation platforms and building resilient communities (OBS: not defined in original PSED, but in a seperate logframe document uploaded in F2).

target.value: 97 Territories under the control of AMISOM/SSF/FMS/FGS (OBS not defined in original PSED, but in a seperate logframe document uploaded in F2).

title.narrative: 1.2 Implementation of community initiated Quick Impact Projects (QIPs) and Peace Strengthening Projects (PSPs).
Improve livelihood: providing basic facilities and amenities to the community (water, health, education and social support).

target.value: 6 out of 7 activities to be implemented: 1 school to be renovated and equipped; distribution of learning materials to children in all sectors; Construction of 1 borehole; construction of 4 shallow wells; Procurement, transportation and distribution of assorted food and NFI to IDPs and vulnerable communities; Engagement of local administration; Support to women in 2 sectors to start small income generating projects

5 of 6 activities to be implemented: Improving health facilities for women at one district hospital; 1 school to be equipped with min. 100 desks and other school equipment determined by community needs assessment; distribution of learning materials to children in all sectors; Construction of 1 borehole; construction of 6 shallow wells; Procurement, transportation and distribution of assorted food and NFI to IDPs and vulnerable communities.

4 of 5 activities to be implemented: Expansion of school equipment programme to cover all sectors based on community needs; 1 district hospital to equipped; Procurement, transportation and distribution of assorted food and NFI to IDPs and vulnerable communities; distribution of learning materials to children in all sectors; construction of 4 shallow wells.

5 of 8 activities to be implemented: Improving health facilities for women at one district hospital, by providing basic equipment and services for reproductive health needs; 4 schools to be equipped with 200 desks and other school equipment determined by community needs assessment; distribution of learning materials to children in all sectors; Construction of 1 Boreholes; 4 Shallow wells to be rehabilitated and equipped; 6 offices of local administrations in regained territories to be equipped; Rehabilitation of 1 Polling station; Renovation and Equipment of 2 schools
